name: Cyberbox II (Puzzlescript port)
description:
Cyberbox 2 is a DOS game originally made by Doug Beeferman. Puzzlescript is an engine designed by Stephen Lavelle. The first game was already ported to Puzzlescript by Anna Anthropy:

https://www.puzzlescript.net/play.html?p=a0e0b94c91f3fe029c89

And she used that port as a basis for her lovely little game, Aunt Flora's Mansion:

https://w.itch.io/aunt-floras-mansion

I've always enjoyed Cyberbox 2, though it is quite a bit more complex than the first one. So I thought I'd port it to Puzzlescript as well! This game is quite special to me, as it's the very first sokoban-style puzzle game I've ever played in my life. Child me was perplexed and intrigued by the game's level editor and I made quite a few! 

Coming back to Cyberbox 2 like this is a nice way for me to celebrate 5 years of Puzzlescript and 10 years of Increpare's inspiring works!

Everything is included here, even the grass. You can copy and paste custom Cyberbox 2 levels into the source code and they will play! 

https://www.puzzlescript.net/editor.html?hack=22b495b87251d63782b22daa3235e0c4

(When you bring in a level, be sure to put a 'zy' in the top-left corner.)
